# Live Tooling - Troubleshooting Guide


# Introduction

 Symptom Table

SYMPTOM

Live tooling drive gets hot.

during a tool change.

Noisy

# Servo Motor


1. Live tooling SL Series: The live

tooling for SL series is belt driven.
2. Live tooling ST Series: The live

tooling for ST series is gear driven.

[Refer to the SET UP LIVE TOOLS PROPERLY ON](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Yo1J5XWy78Y)
[YOUR HAAS LATHE video for more](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Yo1J5XWy78Y)
information.

|mptom Table|Col2|Col3|
|---|---|---|
|SYMPTOM|PROBABLE CAUSE|CORRECTIVE ACTION|
|Live tooling or Y Axis alarms.|Servo motor is contaminated.|Inspect the servo motor.|
|The drive castle or tool is not turning.|The drive belt is faulty.|Inspect the drive belt.|
|Live tooling drive gets hot.|The live tooling bearing cap is out of alignment.|Align the live tooling.|
||The live tooling bearing is faulty.|Examine the bearing.|
|Drive castle does not engage the tool.|The drive castle spring is broken.|Remove the castle and examine the spring.|
|Drive castle hits the tool holder during a tool change.|The drive castle is coming loose.|Tighten the drive castle retaining screw.|
|Noisy|Oil level is low (gear drive only).|Add oil to the live tooling.|
||The live tooling bearing cap is out of alignment.|Align the live tooling bearing cap.|
||The live tooling bearing is faulty.|Examine the bearing.|
||The live tooling gears are faulty (gear drive only).|Inspect gearing for damage|

https://www.haascnc.com/service/troubleshooting-and-how-to/troubleshooting/lathe---live-tooling---troubleshooting-guide.html 2/5

2:
Corrective Action:

Examine the outside of the servo motor for
contamination or damage.

Remove the servo motor. Make sure the shaft
can turn freely.

[Refer to: SIGMA 1 - AXIS SERVO MOTOR AND](https://www.haascnc.com/content/haascnc/en/service/troubleshooting-and-how-to/troubleshooting/sigma-1---axis-servo-motor-and-cables---troubleshooting-guide.html)
[CABLES - TROUBLESHOOTING](https://www.haascnc.com/content/haascnc/en/service/troubleshooting-and-how-to/troubleshooting/sigma-1---axis-servo-motor-and-cables---troubleshooting-guide.html)
[GUIDE or SIGMA 5 - AXIS SERVO MOTOR AND](https://www.haascnc.com/content/haascnc/en/service/troubleshooting-and-how-to/troubleshooting/sigma-1---axis-servo-motor-and-cables---troubleshooting-guide.html)
[CABLES - TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE to](https://www.haascnc.com/content/haascnc/en/service/troubleshooting-and-how-to/troubleshooting/sigma-5---axis-servo-motor-and-cables---troubleshooting-guide.html)
troublehshoot the servo motor.


![](photo/Live Tooling - Troubleshooting Guide.pdf/Live-Tooling---Troubleshooting-Guide.pdf-2-0.png)

# Drive Belt

 Live Tool Alignment

 Live Tool Bearing


Corrective Action:

Examine the drive belt for contamination or
damage.

Make sure the belt has the correct tension.

If the belt is damaged, replace the belt.


![](photo/Live Tooling - Troubleshooting Guide.pdf/Live-Tooling---Troubleshooting-Guide.pdf-2-0.png)

Corrective Action:

Loosen the (4) screws that hold the bearing
cap in position. Do not remove the screws.

Operate the live tooling at a slow speed. This
allows the live tooling shaft to return to
center.

Tighten the (4) screws.

If the drive continues to run hot, loosen the (8)
screws to adjust the live tooling's alignment.


![](photo/Live Tooling - Troubleshooting Guide.pdf/Live-Tooling---Troubleshooting-Guide.pdf-2-0.png)

https://www.haascnc.com/service/troubleshooting-and-how-to/troubleshooting/lathe---live-tooling---troubleshooting-guide.html 3/5


![](photo/Live Tooling - Troubleshooting Guide.pdf/Live-Tooling---Troubleshooting-Guide.pdf-2-0.png)

-----
3:
Corrective Action:

Remove the bearing cap.

Remove the motor.

Remove the belt cover plate, if the live tool is
belt driven. Remove the gearbox cover plate is
the live tool is gear driven.

Remove the belt and drive sprocket, if the live
tool is belt driven. Otherwise, remove the
drive gear.

Examine the bearing [1]. Replace the bearing if
it is faulty.


![](photo/Live Tooling - Troubleshooting Guide.pdf/Live-Tooling---Troubleshooting-Guide.pdf-3-0.png)

# Drive Castle Spring

 Drive Castle

 Oil Level Check


Corrective Action:

Remove the retainer screw [1], washers [2],
driver castle [3], bearing cap [4], locking keys

[5], washer [2], and the spring [6] from the
drive castle shaft.

Examine the spring for damage or breakage. If
the spring is faulty, replace it.


![](photo/Live Tooling - Troubleshooting Guide.pdf/Live-Tooling---Troubleshooting-Guide.pdf-3-0.png)

Corrective Action:

Firmly seat the drive castle onto the livetooling shaft.

Make sure the drive castle retaining screw is
tight.


![](photo/Live Tooling - Troubleshooting Guide.pdf/Live-Tooling---Troubleshooting-Guide.pdf-3-0.png)

https://www.haascnc.com/service/troubleshooting-and-how-to/troubleshooting/lathe---live-tooling---troubleshooting-guide.html 4/5


-----
4:
Corrective Action:

Remove the motor cover [1].

Remove the plug [2] from the oil port.

If oil does not seep out of the port, the oil is
low.

[Refer to: LUBRICANT, GREASE, AND SEALANT](https://www.haascnc.com/content/haascnc/en/service/troubleshooting-and-how-to/reference-documents/lubricant--grease--and-sealant-tables-for-haas-machine-component.html)
[TABLES FOR HAAS MACHINE COMPONENTS.](https://www.haascnc.com/content/haascnc/en/service/troubleshooting-and-how-to/reference-documents/lubricant--grease--and-sealant-tables-for-haas-machine-component.html)


![](photo/Live Tooling - Troubleshooting Guide.pdf/Live-Tooling---Troubleshooting-Guide.pdf-4-0.png)

# Live Tooling Gears


Corrective Action:

Remove the motor cover.

Remove the motor.

Open the gearbox case.

Examine the gears.


![](photo/Live Tooling - Troubleshooting Guide.pdf/Live-Tooling---Troubleshooting-Guide.pdf-4-0.png)

https://www.haascnc.com/service/troubleshooting-and-how-to/troubleshooting/lathe---live-tooling---troubleshooting-guide.html 5/5
